keyFactors.title: Two-Time Defending Champions
keyFactors.description: Florida is the reigning back-to-back Stanley Cup champions. Championship experience and pedigree matters in tight games.

keyFactors.title: Home Ice Advantage
keyFactors.description: Panthers at Amerant Bank Arena where they've built a winning culture. Home crowd provides energy and the team feeds off it.

keyFactors.title: Flyers Rebuilding
keyFactors.description: Philadelphia is in a rebuild year. Young, inexperienced roster still learning to compete consistently against elite teams.

keyFactors.title: Sharp Money Support
keyFactors.description: Line moved from -170 to -180 indicating sharp action on Panthers. Pros backing the chalk here.

riskFactors: Any NHL game can flip on a hot goalie
Flyers have nothing to lose - dangerous opponent
Holiday game can produce strange results

bradMarchand.note: Opened scoring near front of net

carterVerhaeghe.note: Extended lead to 2-0 early in second

quarterBreakdown.description: Panthers controlled play. Brad Marchand opened scoring near front of net. Florida looking dominant early.
Carter Verhaeghe extended lead to 2-0. Panthers in cruise control. Then Emil Andrae scored twice from the point to tie it 2-2.
DISASTER. Tyson Foerster scored go-ahead goal with 45.2 seconds left. Sean Couturier added empty-netter. Stunning 4-2 Flyers upset.

gameResults.gamePace: Panthers controlled possession (27-17 shots) but couldn't finish. Flyers opportunistic in final minute.
gameResults.flyersComeback: Philadelphia earned their 10th come-from-behind victory of the season. Masters of the late-game rally.

whatWentWrong.title: Late-Game Collapse
whatWentWrong.description: Led 2-0, allowed comeback to tie it. Then gave up goal with 45 seconds left. Complete third-period meltdown.

whatWentWrong.title: Couldn't Finish
whatWentWrong.description: Panthers outshot Flyers 27-17 but couldn't convert. Quality over quantity issue.

whatWentWrong.title: Emil Andrae Heroics
whatWentWrong.description: Young defenseman scored twice from the point to tie it. Sometimes young players have breakout games at the worst times.

whatWentWrong.title: Flyers' Resilience
whatWentWrong.description: 10th come-from-behind win of the season. This is a team that never quits, even against defending champs.

statisticalContext.finalMinuteCollapse: Gave up 2 goals in final minute including game-winner
statisticalContext.seriesNote: Third and final regular season matchup - teams split the first two

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: Brutal variance. Panthers dominated shots 27-17 but lost 4-2. Sometimes good bets lose - the process was sound but hockey variance struck. Flyers' opportunistic finishing in the final minute was the difference.

closingLineValue.verdict: Slight negative CLV as line softened. Paid a bit too much juice but process was correct.

keyTakeaways: NHL moneylines are high-variance even for elite teams
Shot differential doesn't guarantee wins (27-17 but lost)
Heavy favorites can still lose to hot goaltending and opportunistic scoring
Final minute collapses happen to the best teams
Consider puck lines for better value on heavy favorites
Emil Andrae and Flyers' never-quit mentality was the story
Sometimes good bets lose - that's sports
verdict: Process was correct, result was painful. Panthers dominated possession 27-17 in shots but Flyers' late-game heroics stole the win. NHL variance at its finest.
